Can anyone tell me why ubuntu hoary wont: it doesn't recognize your sound card or you are using the wrong output (such as ALSA when you should be using OSS)?
do you have a music CD or mp3 handy?
ok, open up XMMS (Applications > Sound & Video > XMMS)
click n the upper left-hand corner of XMMS, it will give you a menu, open your CD or mp3
and play a song...then go back to the menu, and go to Preferences
preferences is in the Options menu
go straight to Options > Preferences menu
on the first tab, there is "Output Plugin" listed underneath "Input Plugins"
basically, try to set the Output to the different options available and try to play your music. Hopefully one of them will give you soun.d
well you have speakers plugged in and turned on, and volume turned up while you were trying each of the different output plugins?
I am guessing you never heard any sound then
I am out of ideas, I haven't ever had to configure a sound card that wasn't properly recognized.
you may want to ask in channel #debian
they're are usually some pretty hardcore folks in there who may be able to help you out
